tweet: I still like Xfce and IceWM. However, I'm leaning toward KDE 4.3, now. Really not as pokey as Gnome. Also, K3B is the best disc-burning app.
WinXP users would like IceWM; Mac users would like KDE 4.3. 4.3 is really nice. OpenSUSE 11.2 is a GORGEOUS KDE implementaion.
Ran BSDAnywhere, on the same machine. Clean, lucid IceWM desktop (5min from live CD boot)--too bad it's not installable.
Tried OpenSUSE 11.2 on an OLD (434MHz, 371MB) 'Celery'--ran (slowly), after a ~5min boot frome the live (KDE 4.3) CD. Nice-looking distro.
Maybe the Americans will do Canada a favour and hand Omar Khadr over to the Cubans--they can make him clean a pig abattoir, as slave labour.
